text: camptocormism or ""bent spine syndrome,"" (BSS) is an extreme forward flexion of the thoracolumbar spine, which often worsens during standing or walking, but completely resolves when laying down. The term itself is derived from the Greek ""kamptos"" (to bend) and ""kormos"" (trunk) BSS was initially considered, especially in wartime, as a result of a psychogenic disorder.
